t: Why do some products on Amazon look the same but have different brand names? - Quora
s: Answer: This is simple to answer. They look similar because the different brands are using the same supplier. This is ok but I suspect they are taking a generic product (like skin cream or headphones) but are not doing any modifications beyond putting their brand name on the product and packaging...

t: Two different sellers, same Brand name, different brand
s: In other words, if I was listing under “TallyTony”, another user was also listing under a different “TallyTony”. Exact same brand name (the actual brand is only two letters, so again, exact brand name), but different products, different sellers.

t: What do Amazon mean by Brand owner?
s: So - I sell the same same slippers in 3 different sizes They are all made by the same manufacturer (lets call the manufacturer XYZ). The GTIN’s when looked up on GS1 confirm this. The slippers have the logo (so Brand) from a well known film and the manufacturer officially licences the Brand ...

t: Same Brand Names, Two different products/categories
s: The store name being the brand name would tend to be a coding nightmare to keep two like named brands separate. A store name does not have to be the brand name as a store can have multiple brands under it.

t: Why do I see so many virtually identical products under different brands when searching for products Amazon? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 2): Because they likely are identical products - the only thing different about them is the brand and perhaps the packaging. These private label products are likely all sourced from the same factory or group of factories, and the brand owners did not bother taking the time or effort...

t: Amazon
s: Yes, assuming it is properly branded. Though it’s still a grey area… Far to many think that just slapping your own brand name on something, makes it’s yours. Patently ridiculous when there are so many sellers doing this, selling the exact same product, with a different name.
